other_tests.findings: Molecular studies revealed a heterozygous R185Q missense mutation in the CASR in the patient and his father.
The proband and his father were heterozygous for a known guanine to adenine substitution at nucleotide position 554 (c.554G>A) in exon 4.
Demonstrated multiple rib fractures, diffuse bone demineralization, and chondrodystrophy in the distal humeri and femora.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up radiographs demonstrated improvement in bone mineralization and no further fractures.

other_tests.findings: Led to marked reductions in serum concentrations of ionized calcium, 1,25(OH)2D, and intact PTH over the next 4 days.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The medication was resumed and continued until calcium levels stabilized, showing effective control of symptoms of hypercalcemia.
